meanings.sent1: I have walked a mille today.
meanings.sent2: She counted a mille stars in the sky.
meanings.sent3: It took a mille tries to get it right.
meanings.sent4: The field stretched out for a mille in every direction.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was filled with a mille gold coins.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one thousandth of an inch
meanings.sent1: The hair was cut to a mille length.
meanings.sent2: The precision required a mille measurement.
meanings.sent3: The tailor needed a mille accuracy for the dress.
meanings.sent4: The jeweler worked with a mille precision on the diamond.
meanings.sent5: The machine was calibrated to a mille inch.

meanings.sent1: The material was as thin as a mille.
meanings.sent2: The gap was less than a mille wide.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted with a mille brush.
meanings.sent4: The engineer adjusted the machine by a mille.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was woven with a mille precision.
